Jx.Record

Extends: Jx.Object

This class is used as a representation (or container) for a single row of data in a Jx.Store.  It is not usually directly instantiated by the developer but rather by the store itself.

Summary
Jx.RecordExtends: Jx.Object
Options
separatorThe separator to pass to the comparator constructor (Jx.Compare) - defaults to ‘.’
Functions
getreturns the value of the requested column.
setSets a given value into the requested column.
equalsCompares the value of a particular column with a given value
asHashReturns the data for this record as a Hash

Options

separator

The separator to pass to the comparator constructor (Jx.Compare) - defaults to ‘.’

Functions

get

get: function (column)

returns the value of the requested column.  Can be programmed to handle pseudo-columns (such as the primaryKey column implemented in this base record).

Parameters

columnthe string, index, or object of the requested column

set

set: function (column,
data)

Sets a given value into the requested column.

Parameters

columnthe object, index, or string name of the target column
datathe data to add to the column

equals

equals: function (column,
value)

Compares the value of a particular column with a given value

Parameters

columnthe column to compare with (either column name or index)
valuethe value to compare to.

Returns

True | False depending on the outcome of the comparison.

asHash

asHash: function()

Returns the data for this record as a Hash

Base class for all other object in the JxLib framework.
